August 15, 1918.

(1)
Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, 447 East 115th Street adjoining the N.W. corner of Pleasant Avenue, the day before
the Feast Day of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
This church was built here about 1885.
July 15, 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel: members of the upper east side Italian colony bringing candles to the church.
July 16, 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, another view.
July 16, 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
(1) Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Giant votive candle being carried in Parade, Pleasant Avenue at 115th Street. The tank and plant of the Standard Gas Light Company shown here, east of Pleasant Avenue from 115th to 114th Streets, have been demolished since the date of this picture. July 16, 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) Giant votive candle for sale at a side street shop, between First and Pleasant Avenues. July 16, 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) Votive candles for sale, at a shop near First Avenue. On the next to the last candle at the right of the picture is a reproduction of the Sistine Madonna. July 16, 1924.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
429-425 East 115th Street, north side, between Pleasant and First Avenues. No. 227 is a two-story frame house.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York

(1) East 115th Street, north side, east of Pleasant Ave. Shown are the rears of houses on the east side of Pleasant Ave., between East 115th and 116th Streets.

November 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) Showing a view further eastward to the Harlem River, as seen across clearance on the site of the Standard Gas Light Co., Plant.

September 12, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as NO. 1, at a later date.

July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

is in the background.
July 16, 1934.

title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
Pleasant Avenue at S.E. corner of 115th Street, showing the refreshment stand doing a brisk business during the annual Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel. (The structure is purely temporary). This block used to contain tanks and other parts of the Standard Gas Light Company plant.

July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

Pleasant Avenue, at 115th Street, seen from clearing behind the S.E. corner of 115th Street, former site of the Standard Gas Light Company's tanks.
At 447 East 115th Street, adjoining the buildings on the N.W. corner, is the Church of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, which has occupied the site since around 1880; it is an Italian Roman Catholic parish.
July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

Pleasant Avenue, north from and including 115th Street, during the Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

Pleasant Avenue, west side, from 115th to 116th Streets, showing also the S.W. and N.E. corners of 115th Street, seen from the clearing at the S.E. corner.

July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Ice cream in various forms is very popular under the hot July sun. The two boys with the little wagon are on the east side of Pleasant Avenue south of 115th Street; the view is west at the S.W. and
N.W. corners of 115th Street.
July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A siren with the euphonic name of Theresa Cararabella stands with her ice cream and waffles on the S.W. corner of Pleasant Avenue and 115th Street. The view is north on the avenue.
July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel-1939: Mobile refreshment purveyors at the Carnival grounds at Pleasant Avenue and East 115th Street. The view is eastward across the cleared site of the future Benjamin Franklin High School. Note the Triboro and Hellgate Bridges in the background.

July 16, 1939
No's. 13-14-15

P. L. Sperr
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
